meanings.definition: To allocate or distribute in advance.
meanings.sent1: The teacher preallots the tasks to each student before the class starts.
meanings.sent2: The company preallots the budget for each department at the beginning of the fiscal year.
meanings.sent3: The chef preallots the ingredients for the recipe, ensuring a smooth cooking process.
meanings.sent4: The captain preallots the roles to the team members, like pieces on a chessboard.
meanings.sent5: The gardener preallots the seeds in the garden, creating a colorful mosaic of flowers.

meanings.sent1: The manager preallots the shifts to the employees a week in advance.
meanings.sent2: The event planner preallots the seating arrangements before the guests arrive.
meanings.sent3: The architect preallots the rooms in the house, ensuring a perfect flow of space.
meanings.sent4: The coach preallots the positions to the players, like pieces on a game board.
meanings.sent5: The artist preallots the colors on the palette, ready to create a masterpiece.
